definition: cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: My parents speak and act like "old children", often make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 我父母的說話做事像個“老頑童”，常讓人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: The antics of wildebeests are often clownish and entertaining.
sentences.chinese: 姿態古怪的牛羚常常叫人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: Chahua never teases with her words – she simply amuses you.
sentences.chinese: 茶花的文字從不刻意調侃，卻看了時常讓人忍俊不禁。
她忍俊不禁地顫動着嘴脣。

sentences.english: On hearing his absurd opinion , i went snickering .
sentences.chinese: 聽了他那荒謬的意見，我忍俊不禁走開了。

sentences.english: She is naughty, but sometimes she is humorlessness and make others cannot help smiling.
sentences.chinese: 她頑皮，有時卻一本正經，讓人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: People still laugh when they watch this movie even though they have watched it over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 即使看了一遍又一遍，人們人就會忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: There is something irrepressibly joyful about the idea of gay ducks.
sentences.chinese: 同性戀鴨子的想法讓人有些忍俊不禁。

definition: uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
